video.title: Salvage Dawgs
video.synopsis: The owners of Black Dog Salvage bid on houses and other buildings due for demolition to save the untold architectural treasures hidden inside.

episodes.synopsis: Robert, Mike and the crew salvage a two-room cabin built in the 1890s and remove a box bay window in one piece, a stove, a stairwell and poplar wood.
episodes.title: Izard House

episodes.synopsis: Mike, Robert and the crew explore an old cotton mill from the late 1800s, where they find wooden louvers, open wire baskets and an old barber chair.
episodes.title: Washington Mill

episodes.synopsis: In Lexington, Virginia, the Black Dog crew salvages a luxury hotel built in 1926 and recoups a peg leg sink, French doors and pelican urinals.
episodes.title: Robert E. Lee Hotel

episodes.synopsis: Robert, Mike and the crew salvage a grist mill used for grinding wheat and other grains, and find patina doors, mill stones and running gears.
episodes.title: Bent Mountain Mill

episodes.synopsis: The crew explores an upscale home built in 1893, recovering a hand-crafted marble mantle, a cast iron sink, vintage cabinets and historical negatives.
episodes.title: James House

episodes.synopsis: The Black Dog Salvage crew tackles an entire city block of Victorian houses in Norfolk, Virginia, including an old tearoom built in 1892.
episodes.title: Ghent Row

episodes.synopsis: A lakeside cabin provides the Black Dog Salvage crew with wood that Mike uses to build a four-post bed that he can sell in the shop.
episodes.title: Smith Mountain Lake

episodes.synopsis: The Black Dog Salvage team recovers parts from a West Virginia church, including accordion doors, a pipe organ and a balcony.
episodes.title: First Baptist Church

episodes.synopsis: In Hot Springs, Virginia, the crew explores stables and a carriage house to find stable doors, a carriage, trusses and a hand-operated elevator.
episodes.title: Homestead Stables

episodes.synopsis: The crew extracts large, fragile stained-glass windows from a church in North Carolina and finds interesting items in a local piano store.
episodes.title: Foursquare Church

episodes.synopsis: The crew salvages a house from the 1940s in Washington, D.C., and finds a large conservatory, bottle glass windows and darkroom supplies.
episodes.title: Post-War Colonial Revival Home

episodes.synopsis: Mike, Robert and their crew tackle a West Virginia house from 1910, finding huge built-in cabinets, mahogany wainscoting and a porcelain tub.
episodes.title: American Foursquare House

episodes.synopsis: An extremely dirty house in Knoxville, Tennessee, turns into a treasure trove of East Lake hardware, mantels, surround tiles and front porch columns.
episodes.title: Stick Style House
